question:
Which of the following geographical landmarks belong to Earth?
  1. Yellowknife Bay
  2. Olympus Mons
  3. Aconcagua Mountain
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
Yellowknife Bay
Yellowknife Bay is located on Mars. It’s one of the lowest spots topographically on the crate floor. NASA’s curiosity rover analysis of clays drilled out from two rock samples in the area of Yellowknife Bay show the freshwater lake existed at a time when other parts of Mars were dried up or dotted with shallow, acidic, salty pool ill suited for life.
Olympus Mons
Olympus Mons, the tallest volcano in the Solar System is located on Mars
Aconcagua
Aconcagua is the highest mountain in the Americas at 6,960.8 metres. It is located in the Andes Mountain range, in the provenance of Mendoza, Argentina. Recently, United States Tyler Armstrong became the youngest person to reach Aconcagua.
